newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore bunkers firm on crude, demand thin.
newsitem.headline: Singapore bunkers firm on crude, demand thin.

text.p: Singapore bunker firmed on Wednesday on crude gains and higher overnight published quotes but demand remained thin, traders said.

They said published spot quotes in the Singapore bunker market rose late in the day causing sellers to quote slightly higher numbers. "Demand is thin as shipowners are unhurried to cover their requirements," a trader with an oil major said. "They prefer to wait for prices to ease."
Bunker 180-cst was quoted at $103-105 per tonne and 380-cst at $97-98. MDO and gas oil were quoted around $198-$203 and $210-$215 respectively. -- Singapore Newsroom (+65-870 3082)
